citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The Licensee has made arrangements with a new veterinarian to provide medical care for the animals and be the part-
time Attending Veterinarian, however there was not a written Program of Veterinary Care from the new veterinarian at the
time of the inspection.
Per this Section, each exhibitor shall employ an Attending Veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-
time Attending Veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program of
veterinary care. The written PVC from the Attending Veterinarian contains specific details regarding preventative medical
care and other health topics to ensure that adequate veterinary care is provided to the species of animals maintained by
the Licensee. A written Program of Veterinary Care from the new Attending Veterinarian is needed. Correct by 11/1/24.

There were no records of acquisition or record of animals on hand available at the time of the inspection for the one bat
acquired since the last inspection, and there was no disposition information for the one bat that has left the facility since
the last inspection.
Per this Section, exhibitors shall make and maintain complete records regarding the details of the acquisition and
disposition of animals in their possession to account for the sources of the animals and any animal transfers. The
Licensee needs to prepare records of acquisition and/or disposition and a record of animals on hand for these animals
and ensure that the animal records are kept current for all future animal acquisitions and/or dispositions. Correct by
11/1/24.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with Licensee.
n
